brussels.Grand Place: Brussels' stunning central square, a UNESCO World Heritage site. The main market surrounds a giant Christmas tree with a light show every 30 minutes.
brussels.Place Ste-Catherine: Cozy market near the old fish market with a Ferris wheel. Great for local Belgian food stalls and warming up with jenever.
brussels.Marché aux Poissons: The old fish market square, connected to Ste-Catherine. Smaller, more intimate stalls with artisan crafts.
brussels.Place de Brouckère: Large open square with the biggest Ferris wheel and ice skating rink. More commercial but great for kids.
brussels.Tour Noire: By the Black Tower, one of Brussels' medieval remnants. A smaller, charming market with a historic backdrop.
brussels.Bruges Markt: Bruges' main market square with the famous Belfry tower. Magical medieval setting — worth the day trip.

paris.Tuileries Garden: Elegant market along the famous gardens near the Louvre. Ferris wheel views of the Eiffel Tower. Very Parisian.
paris.La Villette: Near your Airbnb! A more local, less touristy market in the 19th arrondissement with great food stalls.
paris.Champs-Élysées: The famous avenue transformed with Christmas lights and chalets. Touristy but undeniably beautiful.
paris.Notre Dame: Market on the Left Bank facing the cathedral (still under reconstruction). Intimate setting with river views.
paris.Saint-Germain: Upscale Left Bank neighborhood market. Sophisticated crafts and gourmet food in a chic setting.
paris.Hôtel de Ville: In front of Paris' ornate City Hall with an ice skating rink. Central location, beautifully lit.

strasbourg.Place du Château: Next to the stunning Gothic cathedral. The oldest Christmas market in France, dating to 1570.
strasbourg.Cathedral Market: Surrounding Strasbourg Cathedral with traditional Alsatian crafts. Look up at the famous astronomical clock.
strasbourg.Place Gutenberg: Named after the printing press inventor who lived here. Cozy square with a giant Christmas tree.
strasbourg.Christkindelsmärik: The original market — 'Christ Child Market' in Alsatian. Traditional crafts, bredele cookies, and vin chaud.
strasbourg.Petite France: The fairytale half-timbered district along canals. Smaller stalls tucked into the cobblestone streets.
strasbourg.Place Kléber: The main square with Strasbourg's tallest Christmas tree (100+ feet). Heart of the festivities.

zurich.Bahnhofstrasse (Lucy): Zurich's famous shopping street lit by 'Lucy' — 11,000 crystal lights overhead. Window shopping paradise.
zurich.Wienachtsdorf: Christmas Village at Sechseläutenplatz by the opera house. 100+ wooden chalets and a giant tree.
zurich.Niederdorf: The Old Town's winding streets filled with small stalls and cozy restaurants. Very local vibe.
zurich.Old Town: Scattered throughout Zurich's historic center. Medieval streets decorated with lights and small markets.
zurich.Sechseläutenplatz: The large square by Lake Zurich hosting the main Christmas village. Singing Christmas tree!

salzburg.Cathedral Square: Domplatz — the main market beneath Salzburg's baroque cathedral. Stunning mountain backdrop.
salzburg.Residenzplatz: Connected to Cathedral Square by the old Residenz palace. Traditional Austrian crafts and food.
salzburg.Mirabellplatz: By the Mirabell Palace gardens (Sound of Music fame!). Smaller, elegant market.
salzburg.Hellbrunn Palace: A bit outside town at the famous trick fountain palace. More spacious, family-friendly, with forest setting.
salzburg.Getreidegasse: Mozart's birthplace street with wrought-iron shop signs. Festive shopping in a medieval lane.

vienna.Rathausplatz: The big one! In front of Vienna's Gothic City Hall. Ice skating, carnival rides, and hundreds of stalls.
vienna.Maria-Theresien-Platz: Between the twin museums (Art History & Natural History). More upscale, less crowded, beautiful setting.
vienna.Stephansplatz: Around St. Stephen's Cathedral in the heart of Vienna. Traditional market with the iconic Gothic spire above.
vienna.Belvedere Palace: Romantic market at the baroque palace. Smaller crowds, stunning palace backdrop, great photo ops.
vienna.Spittelberg: Charming cobblestone neighborhood with artisan crafts. Bohemian vibe, local favorite, great mulled wine.
